file.name: openapi.yml
file.content: openapi: 3.0.1 info: title: payroll description: >- This is a generated connector for [WorkDay payroll REST API v2](https://community.workday.com/sites/default/files/file-hosting/restapi/index.html) OpenAPI specification. The Payroll service enables you to access and manage payroll information,such as pay groups, payroll inputs, and tax rates. x-ballerina-init-description: > The connector initialization requires setting the API credentials. Follow [this guide] https://credentials.workday.com/docs/authentication/ and obtain tokens. x-ballerina-display: label: Workday Payroll iconPath: icon.png version: v2 tags: - name: jobs - name: payGroupDetails description: Provides the ability to view pay group details. Inactive and External Pay Group Details are not supported. - name: payGroups description: Provides the ability to view pay groups. Inactive and External Pay Groups are not supported. - name: payrollInputs description: "Provides the ability to get, add, update, and delete payroll inputs\ \ for workers and pay components. These REST APIs: \n\n* Are secured to the Worker\ \ Data: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) and Self-Service: Payroll Public API\ \ (Payroll Input) security domains. \n\n* The POST, PATCH, DELETE methods for\ \ self-service users require Pay Component Security Segments. Self-service users\ \ can view their own Payroll Inputs using GET without a Pay Component Security\ \ Segment. \n\n* Pay Component Segment Security is only supported on the Self-Service:\ \ Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) security domain. The Segment-Based Security\ \ Group must use a Self-Service â€“ Worker security group type as the basis.\ \ \n\n* Don't support Payroll Tax Location Mapping or Pay Components that require\ \ Special Entry." - name: taxRates description: Use these REST APIs to access company SUI tax rates. - name: Prompt Values description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service. paths: /jobs/{id}/payGroup/{subresourceID}: get: tags: - jobs summary: Retrieves a single pay group instance. operationId: getPayGroupBySubResourceID description: |- Retrieves a pay group instance with the specified ID. Secured by: Set Up: Payroll - Pay Group Specific Scope: Core Payroll parameters: - name: id in: path description: The Workday ID of the resource. required: true schema: type: string - name: subresourceID in: path description: The Workday ID of the subresource. required: true schema: type: string responses: 200: description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/payGroupViewDetail' 400: description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 401: description: Invalid resource or operation. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 403: description: User has insufficient permissions. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 404: description: Resource not found. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' default: description: An error occurred. content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' /payGroups/{id}: get: tags: - payGroups summary: Retrieves a single pay group instance. operationId: getPayGroupByID description: |- Retrieves a pay group with the specified ID. Secured by: Set Up: Payroll - Pay Group Specific Scope: Core Payroll parameters: - name: id in: path description: The Workday ID of the resource. required: true schema: type: string responses: 200: description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/payGroupViewDetail' 400: description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 401: description: Invalid resource or operation. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 403: description: User has insufficient permissions. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 404: description: Resource not found. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' default: description: An error occurred. content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' /jobs/{id}/payGroup: get: tags: - jobs summary: Retrieves the pay group for a specified job ID. This method always returns 1 pay group. operationId: getPayGroupByJobID description: |- Retrieves the pay group for a specified job ID. Secured by: Set Up: Payroll - Pay Group Specific Scope: Core Payroll parameters: - name: id in: path description: The Workday ID of the resource. required: true schema: type: string - name: effective in: query description: The effective date of the pay group, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd. schema: type: string format: date - name: limit in: query description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100. schema: type: integer format: int64 - name: offset in: query description: 'The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.' schema: type: integer format: int64 responses: 200: description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. content: application/json: schema: type: object properties: data: type: array items: $ref: '#/components/schemas/payGroupViewDetail' total: type: integer format: int64 description: collection something or other 400: description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 401: description: Invalid resource or operation. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 403: description: User has insufficient permissions. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 404: description: Resource not found. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' default: description: An error occurred. content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' /values/taxRatesGroup/companyInstances/: get: tags: - Prompt Values description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service. operationId: getInstanceForEndpointParameters responses: 200: description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. content: 'application/json': schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/MULTIPLE_INSTANCE_MODEL_REFERENCE' default: description: An error occurred. content: 'application/json': schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' /values/payrollInputsGroup/worktags/: get: tags: - Prompt Values description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service. operationId: getWorkTagInstancesForEndpointParameters parameters: - name: payComponent in: query description: The pay component for the worktags. You can use a returned id from GET/values/payrollInputsGroup/payComponents. schema: type: string - name: worker in: query description: The Workday ID of the worker. You can use a returned id from GET /workers in the Staffing service. schema: type: string - name: startDate in: query description: The start date for the positions, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd. schema: type: string format: date - name: endDate in: query description: The end date for the positions, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd. schema: type: string format: date responses: 200: description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. content: 'application/json': schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/MULTIPLE_INSTANCE_MODEL_REFERENCE' default: description: An error occurred. content: 'application/json': schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' /payGroupDetails/{id}: get: tags: - payGroupDetails summary: Retrieves a single pay group detail instance. operationId: getPayGroupDetailsByID description: |- Retrieves a pay group detail with the specified ID. Secured by: Set Up: Payroll - Pay Group Specific Scope: Core Payroll parameters: - name: id in: path description: The Workday ID of the resource. required: true schema: type: string responses: 200: description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/payGroupDetailView' 400: description: Invalid request. Secured by: Worker Position: View Scope: Staffing parameters: - name: limit in: query description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100. schema: type: integer format: int64 - name: offset in: query description: 'The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.' schema: type: integer format: int64 responses: 200: description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. content: application/json: schema: type: object properties: data: type: array items: $ref: '#/components/schemas/jobData' total: type: integer format: int64 description: collection something or other 400: description: Invalid request. You can use a returned id from GET/values/payrollInputsGroup/payComponents. schema: type: string - name: worker in: query description: The Workday ID of the worker. You can use a returned id from GET /workers in the Staffing service. schema: type: string - name: startDate in: query description: The start date for the positions, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd. schema: type: string format: date - name: endDate in: query description: The end date for the positions, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd. schema: type: string format: date responses: 200: description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. content: 'application/json': schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/MULTIPLE_INSTANCE_MODEL_REFERENCE' default: description: An error occurred. content: 'application/json': schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' /payGroupDetails: get: tags: - payGroupDetails summary: Retrieves a collection of pay group details. operationId: getCollectionOfPayGroupDetails description: |- Retrieves all pay group details. Inactive and External Pay Group Details are not supported. Secured by: Set Up: Payroll - Pay Group Specific Scope: Core Payroll parameters: - name: limit in: query description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100. schema: type: integer format: int64 - name: offset in: query description: 'The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.' schema: type: integer format: int64 - name: runCategories in: query description: 'One or more Workday IDs of run categories for the pay group. You can use returned ids from GET /values/payrollInputsGroup/runCategories.You can specify 1 or more runCategories query parameters, example: runCategories=category1&runCategories=category2' style: form explode: true schema: type: array items: type: string responses: 200: description: Successful response. Secured by: Worker Position: View Scope: Staffing parameters: - name: id in: path description: The Workday ID of the resource. required: true schema: type: string responses: 200: description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/jobData' 400: description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 401: description: Invalid resource or operation. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 403: description: User has insufficient permissions. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 404: description: Resource not found. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' default: description: An error occurred. content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' /values/payrollInputsGroup/positions/: get: tags: - Prompt Values description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters in this service. operationId: getPositionInstancesForOtherEndpoints parameters: - name: payComponent in: query description: The pay component for the worktags. You can use a returned id from GET/values/payrollInputsGroup/payComponents. schema: type: string - name: worker in: query description: The Workday ID of the worker. You can use a returned id from GET /workers in the Staffing service. schema: type: string - name: startDate in: query description: The start date for the positions, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd. schema: type: string format: date - name: endDate in: query description: The end date for the positions, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd. schema: type: string format: date responses: 200: description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. content: 'application/json': schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/MULTIPLE_INSTANCE_MODEL_REFERENCE' default: description: An error occurred. content: 'application/json': schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' /payrollInputs/{id}: get: tags: - payrollInputs summary: Retrieves a single payroll input instance. operationId: getPayRollInputInstance description: |- Retrieves a payroll input with the specified ID. Secured by: Self-Service: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input), Worker Data: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) Scope: Core Payroll parameters: - name: id in: path description: The Workday ID of the resource. required: true schema: type: string responses: 200: description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/payrollInputView' 400: description: |- Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) Error Code | Validation Message --- | --- A552 | Specify a Start Date. A116 | Specify these payroll worktag types for [pc]: [worktags]. A119 | Specify an End Date that is on or after the Start Date. A551 | Specify a Related Calculation that's valid for [pc]. A137 | Specify valid run categories. Invalid run categories are: [runcats] A560 | Specify a position for [pc]. A548 | Specify a Pay Component configured with the correct Worker country. A550 | Specify a Type for each Input Details row. A559 | Specify an End Date for One-time Payroll Input. A139 | Specify worktags valid for payroll. Invalid worktags are: [worktags]. A555 | Specify a Pay Component. A98 | Specify only 1 Worktag for each worktag type. A138 | Specify a Position that's valid for [worker]. A940 | Specify a valid level 1 project plan phase. This phase isn't supported: [phase] A142 | Enable Input Allowed on [pc] - [pcrc]. A141 | Specify only 1 Input Details row for each input Type. A120 | Enable Input Amount Allowed on [pc]. content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 401: description: Invalid resource or operation. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 403: description: User has insufficient permissions. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 404: description: Resource not found. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' default: description: An error occurred. content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' delete: tags: - payrollInputs summary: Deletes an existing payroll input instance. operationId: deleteExistingPayroll description: "Deletes an existing payroll input instance with the specified\ \ ID. \n\nThe Pay Component Segment Security configuration is required. Note\ \ that Pay Component Segment Security is supported only on the Self-Service:\ \ Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) security domain. The Segment-Based Security\ \ Group must use a Self-Service â€“ Worker security group type as the\ \ basis.\n\nSecured by: Self-Service: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input),\ \ Worker Data: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input)\n\nScope: Core Payroll" parameters: - name: id in: path description: The Workday ID of the resource. required: true schema: type: string responses: 200: description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Deleting resource. content: {} 400: description: |- Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) Error Code | Validation Message --- | --- A552 | Specify a Start Date. A116 | Specify these payroll worktag types for [pc]: [worktags]. A119 | Specify an End Date that is on or after the Start Date. A551 | Specify a Related Calculation that's valid for [pc]. A554 | You can't delete a payroll input that's used in an off-cycle payment. A137 | Specify valid run categories. Invalid run categories are: [runcats] A560 | Specify a position for [pc]. A548 | Specify a Pay Component configured with the correct Worker country. A550 | Specify a Type for each Input Details row. A556 | You can't delete an external payroll input. A559 | Specify an End Date for One-time Payroll Input. A139 | Specify worktags valid for payroll. Invalid worktags are: [worktags]. A555 | Specify a Pay Component. A98 | Specify only 1 Worktag for each worktag type. A140 | You can't delete a payroll input that's used in a completed payroll result. A561 | [pc] isn't configured for self-service. You can't delete your own payroll input. A558 | You can't delete a payroll input that's used in a completed or suspended retro result. A138 | Specify a Position that's valid for [worker]. A940 | Specify a valid level 1 project plan phase. This phase isn't supported: [phase] A142 | Enable Input Allowed on [pc] - [pcrc]. A141 | Specify only 1 Input Details row for each input Type. A120 | Enable Input Amount Allowed on [pc]. content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 401: description: Invalid resource or operation. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 403: description: User has insufficient permissions. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 404: description: Resource not found. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' default: description: An error occurred. content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' patch: tags: - payrollInputs summary: Partially updates an existing payroll input instance. operationId: UpdateAnExistingPayroll description: "Partially updates an existing payroll input instance with the\ \ specified ID and the specified data in the request body. Before calling\ \ this PATCH method, call the GET /payrollInputs method to retrieve the current\ \ payroll input information.\n\nYou cannot update the worker field with this\ \ PATCH method. \n\nThe Pay Component Segment Security configuration is\ \ required. Note that Pay Component Segment Security is supported only on\ \ the Self-Service: Payroll Public API (Payroll Input) security domain. The\ \ Segment-Based Security Group must use a Self-Service â€“ Worker security\ \ group type as the basis.\n\n**Starting in v2:**\nThe fieldEditability field\ \ in the GET /payrollInputs/{ID} response determines the fields that you can\ \ update with the PATCH /payrollInputs method. Possible fieldEditability values:\ \ \n\n* all - All fields can be updated, except the worker field. \n\n\ * none - No fields can be updated. \n\n* endDateOnly - Only the endDate\ \ field can be updated. \n\n** In v1: **\n\nThe lastPeriodCompleted and\ \ usedInCompletedResult fields in the GET /payrollInputs/{ID} response determine\ \ the fields you can update with this PATCH method: \n\n* If lastPeriodCompleted\ \ and usedInCompletedResult are both false, all fields can be updated, except\ \ the worker field. \n\n* If lastPeriodCompleted and usedInCompletedResult\ \ are both true, no fields can be updated. \n\n* If only usedInCompletedResult\ \ is true, only the endDate field can be updated.\n\nSecured by: Self-Service:\ \ Payroll Public API (Payroll Input), Worker Data: Payroll Public API (Payroll\ \ Input)\n\nScope: Core Payroll" parameters: - name: id in: path description: The Workday ID of the resource. required: true schema: type: string requestBody: content: 'application/json': schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/payrollInputView' required: true responses: 200: description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. Updating resource. content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/payrollInputView' 400: description: |- Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) Error Code | Validation Message --- | --- A552 | Specify a Start Date. A551 | Specify a Related Calculation that's valid for [pc]. A13 | You can't include the worker. A561 | [pc] isn't configured for self-service. You can't update your own payroll input. A121 | Specify an End Date on or after the end date of the last completed pay period for the appropriate run category. A548 | Specify a Pay Component configured with the correct Worker country. A550 | Specify a Type for each Input Details row. A557 | You can't change any fields because the pay input is already used in a completed pay result or retro result. A555 | Specify a Pay Component. A98 | Specify only 1 Worktag for each worktag type. A138 | Specify a Position that's valid for [worker]. A142 | Enable Input Allowed on [pc] - [pcrc]. A553 | You can only change the end date because the pay input is already in use in a completed pay result or retro result. A116 | Specify these payroll worktag types for [pc]: [worktags]. A119 | Specify an End Date that is on or after the Start Date. A556 | You can't update an external payroll input. A137 | Specify valid run categories. Invalid run categories are: [runcats] A560 | Specify a position for [pc]. A140 | You can't change any fields because the pay input is already used in a completed pay result or retro result. A994 | You can only update this payroll input with the payroll input lines that are associated with it. Change these payroll input lines: [input line IDs] A559 | Specify an End Date for One-time Payroll Input. A139 | Specify worktags valid for payroll. Invalid worktags are: [worktags]. A940 | Specify a valid level 1 project plan phase. This phase isn't supported: [phase] A554 | You can't update a payroll input that's used in an off-cycle payment. A141 | Specify only 1 Input Details row for each input Type. A120 | Enable Input Amount Allowed on [pc]. content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 401: description: Invalid resource or operation. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 403: description: User has insufficient permissions. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' 404: description: Resource not found. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages) content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' default: description: An error occurred. content: application/json: schema: $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE' x-codegen-request-body-name: payrollInputView /payrollInputs: get: tags: - payrollInputs summary: Retrieves a collection of payroll inputs. At least 1 query parameter is required to get data. operationId: getCollectionOfPayroll description: "Retrieves all payroll inputs. At least 1 query parameter is required\ \ to get data. \n\nThe Pay Component Segment Security configuration doesn't\ \ apply to the GET method. Self-service users can view all of their own Payroll\ \ Inputs.\n\n**Starting in v2:**\nThe fieldEditability field in the GET /payrollInputs/{ID}\ \ response determines the fields that you can update with the PATCH /payrollInputs\ \ method. Possible fieldEditability values: \n\n* all - All fields can be\ \ updated, except the worker field. \n\n* none - No fields can be updated.\ \ \n\n* endDateOnly - Only the endDate field can be updated. \n\n** In\ \ v1: **\nThe lastPeriodCompleted and usedInCompletedResult fields in the\ \ GET /payrollInputs/{ID} response determine the fields that you can update\ \ with the PATCH /payrollInputs method. \n\n* If lastPeriodCompleted and\ \ usedInCompletedResult are both false, all fields can be updated, except\ \ the worker field. \n\n* If lastPeriodCompleted and usedInCompletedResult\ \ are both true, no fields can be updated. \n\n* If only usedInCompletedResult\ \ is true, only the endDate field can be updated.\n\nSecured by: Self-Service:\ \ Payroll Public API (Payroll Input), Worker Data: Payroll Public API (Payroll\ \ Input)\n\nScope: Core Payroll" parameters: - name: endDate in: query description: The end date filter which returns payroll inputs that are active on or before the end date, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd. schema: type: string format: date - name: limit in: query description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100. schema: type: integer format: int64 - name: offset in: query description: 'The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.' schema: type: integer format: int64 - name: payComponent in: query description: The Workday ID of the pay component for the payroll input. You can use a returned id from GET /values/payrollInputsGroup/payComponents. style: form explode: true schema: type: array items: type: string - name: startDate in: query description: The start date filter which returns payroll inputs that are active on or after the start date, using the date format yyyy-mm-dd. schema: type: string format: date - name: worker in: query description: The Workday ID of worker for the payroll input. You can use a returned id from GET /workers in the Staffing service. style: form explode: true schema: type: array items: type: string responses: 200: description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data. content: application/json: schema: type: object properties: data: type: array items: $ref: '#/components/schemas/payrollInputView' total: type: integer format: int64 description: collection something or other 400: description: |- Invalid request. Invalid run categories are: [runcats] A560 | Specify a position for [pc]. A548 | Specify a Pay Component configured with the correct Worker country. A550 | Specify a Type for each Input Details row. A559 | Specify an End Date for One-time Payroll Input. A139 | Specify worktags valid for payroll. Invalid worktags are: [worktags]. A555 | Specify a Pay Component. Request Element Values - Company: [company] ([companyWID]), State: [state] ([stateWID]), Start Date: ([start]) A12 | Enter an Applicable Rate that's less than 10, contains up to 6 decimal places, and is a positive number. Request Element Values - Company: [company] ([companyWID]), State: [state] ([stateWID]), Start Date: ([start]) A121 | Enter an End Date that's not between the start and end dates of another row.
